content: f214 crayon box baby blanket by fairmount fibers design team all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free for questions or support please email info@fairmountfibers com 2/14/25 © fairmount fibers ltd 2025 not to be reproduced or re-knit for profit page 1 of 2 f214 size instructions approx 32 x 36 granny square block with cc ch5 join with slip_stitch in first chain st to form ring materials manos del uruguay alegria grande 75% superwash round 1 ch3 2dc into ring ch2 3dc into ring 3 times ch2 merino wool 25% polyamide approx 100g / 197 yds join with slip_stitch to top of chain cut cc and fasten_off 6 skip mc round 2 join mc with slip_stitch in any ch2 space ch3 2dc into same manos del uruguay alegria grande bocados 75% space ch2 3dc into same space *ch1 3dc ch2 3dc all into next superwash merino wool 25% polyamide approx 25g / 49 ch2 space repeat from * twice more ch1 join with slip_stitch to top of yds 1 each of 9 colors first chain shown in ag2349 oxygen with agb2102 juanita agb2058 round 3 turn the work around so what was previously the turmeric agb2020 spirulina agb2363 tahiti agb2394 teal underside is facing you ch3 2dc into ch1 space ch1 3dc ch2 agb2419 oceano agb2600 magenta agb21905 fuchsia and 3dc all into next ch2 space *ch1 3dc into ch1 space ch1 3dc ch2 agb2199 carmine 3dc all into ch2 space repeat from * twice more ch1 join with slip_stitch to top of first chain us h/8 5 0mm hook or size to obtain gauge round 4 turn the work around so what was previously the gauge underside is facing you ch3 2dc into ch1 space ch1 3dc ch2 approx 9 double_crochet = 2 finished square measures 3 75 3dc all into next ch2 space * ch1 3dc into next chain 1 space twice ch1 3dc ch2 3dc all into next ch2 space repeat from * twice abbreviations more ch1 3dc into next ch1 space ch1 join with slip_stitch to top of cc contrast color first chain cut mc and fasten_off chain chain double_crochet double_crochet blanket mc main color make 72 granny square blocks 8 with each of the 9 ccs round round we found it easiest to make all the centers first and then do slip_stitch slip_stitch all the mc space space st stitch assembly lay the finished squares out in an arrangement you find notes pleasing join by your preferred method we used slip_stitch feel free to use any hook size that produces a fabric you like crochet overlapping and working through the outermost but be aware that the final dimensions of your blanket and strand of each block s final round your yarn requirements may change if you vary too much from the measurements given with mc single_crochet around the outer edge of the blanket working 4 single_crochet into each ch2 corner space weave in yarn ends as you finish each block or a few
